name: rusty
content:
rusty adjective
(METAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 covered with rust (= metal decay): a rusty car/nail
More examplesFewer examplesMy old bicycle was so rusty that the gears had frozen.The door squeaked as it swung back and forth on its rusty hinges.There was a pile of rusty old cans by the door.I pushed back the rusty old gate and staggered into the garden.The track remains in position but rusty with disuse.

rusty adjective
(NEEDING PRACTICE)
B2 If a skill you had is rusty, it is not as good as it was because you have not practised it: My Italian is a bit rusty these days.

(esp. of a person) not as good at knowing or doing something as you once were, because you have not practiced it in a long time: We’re a little rusty after having the summer off.
(of the surface of something made of iron or steel) covered with a red-brown substance that formed as a result of decay caused by reacting with air and water: People would toss their soda cans into rusty old barrels.
